Record Class Vector2f

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Vector2f
Record Components:
x - the x-coordinate
y - the y-coordinate
public record Vector2f(float x, float y) extends Record
An immutable 2-dimensional vector using float coordinates.

      public Vector2f translate(float dx, float dy)
      Translates the vector by the specified amounts in the x and y directions.
      Parameters:
      dx - the amount to translate in the x-direction
      dy - the amount to translate in the y-direction
      Returns:
      a new Vector2f object representing the translated vector

    • normalized

      public Vector2f normalized()
      Normalizes the vector to a unit vector by dividing each component by its length.
      Returns:
      a new Vector2f object representing the normalized vector
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the vector has a length of zero

    • orthogonal

      public Vector2f orthogonal(boolean sweep)
      Calculates the orthogonal vector based on the sweep direction.
      Parameters:
      sweep - a boolean indicating the sweep direction. If true, the orthogonal vector is computed in a clockwise direction; otherwise, it is computed in a counterclockwise direction.
      Returns:
      a new Vector2f object representing the orthogonal vector.

    • length

      public double length()
      Calculate the length of vector.
      Returns:
      the length

    • angle

      public double angle()
      Compute the vector's angle in radians.
      Returns:
      angle in radians in the range [-π,π]

    • negate

      public Vector2f negate()
      Negates the vector by inverting the signs of its components.
      Returns:
      a new Vector2f object where each component's sign is opposite that of the original vector

      public final boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one. The objects are equal if the other object is of the same class and if all the record components are equal. All components in this record class are compared with the compare method from their corresponding wrapper classes.
